title: Pandemic Excuses Won’t Fly for the Schools
sub_head: The problems with literacy run deeper.
body:
Your editorial “The School Shutdowns and Lost Literacy” (Feb. 25) notes that reading skills among kindergartners have declined after school shutdowns. Even more disturbing is that only 55% were on track for reading before the pandemic. Nearly a third were “far behind.” This is an indictment of the education system.
Stephen Happel
